SEARCH
Module help
Package help

Class Manager_PersonnelController

java.lang.Object
help.Manager_PersonnelController
public class Manager_PersonnelController extends Object
Controller class for managing personnel within the application. This class handles the functionality for personnel management, such as viewing, adding, and removing staff members.

  • Method Details

    • handleCloseButtonAction

      private void handleCloseButtonAction(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Handles the action of closing the application window. This method is called when the close button is pressed. It closes the current stage (window).
      Parameters:
      event - The event that triggered the action.

    • handleMinimizeButtonAction

      private void handleMinimizeButtonAction(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Handles the action of minimizing the application window. This method is called when the minimize button is pressed. It minimizes the current stage (window).
      Parameters:
      event - The event that triggered the action.

    • setCurrentUsername

      public void setCurrentUsername(String username)
      Sets the current username of the user. This method is used to update the username of the logged-in user.
      Parameters:
      username - The current username of the user.

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Initializes the user interface by setting up the table columns and loading user data. This method is called automatically when the controller is initialized.

    • loadUsers

      private void loadUsers()
      Loads and displays the users in the personnel table. Retrieves a list of users from the database and updates the table accordingly.

    • handleAddNewStaffButton

      private void handleAddNewStaffButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Handles the action of adding a new staff member. This method opens a dialog window to add a new staff member to the system. Once the dialog is closed, the table is refreshed with updated user data.
      Parameters:
      event - The event that triggered the action.

    • handleFireStaffButton

      private void handleFireStaffButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Handles the action of firing a staff member. This method is called when the fire staff button is pressed. It confirms the deletion of a staff member and removes them from the system.
      Parameters:
      event - The event that triggered the action.

    • handleSignOutButtonAction

      private void handleSignOutButtonAction(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Handles the action when the Sign Out button is clicked. This method switches the current scene to the login screen.
      Parameters:
      event - The action event triggered by the Sign Out button.

    • showAlert

      private void showAlert(String title, String content)
      Shows an alert message with the specified title and content. The alert is modal, meaning it will block interaction with the main window until it is dismissed.
      Parameters:
      title - The title of the alert.
      content - The content text to display in the alert.

    • refreshUserTable

      public void refreshUserTable()
      Refreshes the user table by reloading the user data. This method is called when the AddStaffController wants to refresh the table of users.

    • handlePersonnelButtonAction

      private void handlePersonnelButtonAction(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Handles the action when the Personnel button is clicked. This method refreshes the current view and updates the button states for visual feedback.
      Parameters:
      event - The action event triggered by the Personnel button.

    • handleProductManagement

      private void handleProductManagement()
      Handles the action when the Product Management button is clicked. This method switches the scene to the product management view.
      Parameters:
      event - The action event triggered by the Product Management button.

    • handlePersonnelManagement

      private void handlePersonnelManagement()
      Handles the action when the Personnel Management button is clicked. This method switches the scene to the personnel management view.
      Parameters:
      event - The action event triggered by the Personnel Management button.

    • handlePriceManagement

      private void handlePriceManagement()
      Handles the action when the Price Management button is clicked. This method switches the scene to the price management view.
      Parameters:
      event - The action event triggered by the Price Management button.

    • handleRevenueTax

      private void handleRevenueTax()
      Handles the action when the Revenue and Tax button is clicked. This method switches the scene to the revenue and tax management view.
      Parameters:
      event - The action event triggered by the Revenue and Tax button.

    • setupEditableColumns

      private void setupEditableColumns()
      Sets up the editable columns for the user information table. Each column (First Name, Last Name, Username, Password, and Role) is configured to allow in-place editing. The method also sets up commit actions that update the user information when changes are made.

    • updateUser

      private void updateUser(User user, String oldUsername)
      Updates the user information in the database. After updating the user, a success or error message is shown based on the outcome.
      Parameters:
      user - The user whose information will be updated.
      oldUsername - The old username to check for username changes.

    • validateUsername

      private boolean validateUsername(String username)
      Validates the provided username. Ensures the username is not null or empty.
      Parameters:
      username - The username to validate.
      Returns:
      true if the username is valid, otherwise false.

    • validatePassword

      private boolean validatePassword(String password)
      Validates the provided password. Ensures the password is at least 6 characters long.
      Parameters:
      password - The password to validate.
      Returns:
      true if the password is valid, otherwise false.

    • showAlert

      private void showAlert(javafx.scene.control.Alert.AlertType alertType, String title, String content)
      Displays an alert with the specified type, title, and content. The alert will block interaction with the main window until dismissed.
      Parameters:
      alertType - The type of the alert (e.g., INFORMATION, ERROR).
      title - The title of the alert window.
      content - The content text to display in the alert.
